meanings.definition: The soul of a dead person believed to appear to the living
meanings.sent1: Many people claim to have seen ghosts in old houses.
meanings.sent2: The ghost of the pirate is said to haunt the island.
meanings.sent3: The ghost of the missing sock always seems to reappear in the laundry.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her past mistakes haunted her like ghosts in the night.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure floated silently through the room, sending shivers down everyone's spine.

meanings.definition: A faint trace or remnant of something
meanings.sent1: There were ghosts of footprints in the sand, washed away by the tide.
meanings.sent2: The ghost of her perfume lingered in the room long after she had left.
meanings.sent3: The ghost of a smile played on his lips as he remembered the joke.
meanings.sent4: The ghost of a melody hummed softly in the background, barely audible.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly outline of the old building could still be seen against the skyline.

meanings.sent1: The ghost of a smile played on her face, hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent2: The ghost of happiness in his eyes couldn't mask the sadness within.
meanings.sent3: The ghost of confidence in his voice betrayed his nervousness.
meanings.sent4: The ghost of success surrounded her, but she felt like a failure inside.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly illusion of perfection shattered when reality set in.
